title: Gecko engine doesn't allow some windows to open
author: klui2k1
body_snippet:
<!--
Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests.  All other topics will be closed.

Before opening an issue, please search for a duplicate or closed issue.
Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue.
-->

<!-- Bug -->
|||I have a few entries in mRemoteNG where they use HTTPS, port 443, with the Gecko (Firefox) rendering engine. I find that some of them have windows that create child windows but they fail to open. One that I use all the time is Zoneminde...

comments.snippet: Could you confirm is it still an issue for you with newer version?
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet: Thanks for letting me know. I downloaded the most recent nightly build but my old connection file isn't recognized. What changed between 1.77.1.27713 and 1.77.2.28860?
comments.author: klui2k1

comments.snippet:
> Thanks for letting me know. I downloaded the most recent nightly build but my old connection file isn't recognized. What changed between 1.77.1.27713 and 1.77.2.28860?

where is no changes in connection file part. Could you navigate and open it manually? 
C:\Users\{{user name}}\AppData\Roaming\mRemoteNG
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
I tried it several times last night and I was finally able to open my settings. I tried it the other day but it didn't work for some reason. I am using mRemoteNG in portable mode so my settings are kept in the same directory as the application.

The app also can't seem to locate my extApps.xml (also in the same folder as the application). How can tell it to use the file and not in %appdata%?

I've been plagued by https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/1975 for the nightly build so can...
comments.author: klui2k1

comments.snippet:
> I tried it several times last night and I was finally able to open my settings. I tried it the other day but it didn't work for some reason. I am using mRemoteNG in portable mode so my settings are kept in the same directory as the application.

that seems to be a different issue. 

> The app also can't seem to locate my extApps.xml (also in the same folder as the application). How can tell it to use the file and not in %appdata%?

Perhaps need to add option to force check in user desire...
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.
comments.author: robertpopa22
